title: fix your hitboxes ffs... they're retarded
body:

replies.body:
this is because there are 3 sizes of hitboxes (small, medium and large). theyre shaped in a circle around your champion. something similar goes for skillshot projectiles.

the hitboxes dont have to match the shape of the champion model. in fact in many cases they dont. now imagine them also not matching the projectile perfectly.

skillshots are considered a "hit" if the circular skillshot hitbox touches the circular chamion hitbox on any side. this creates weird effects where skillshots hit even if they visually dont, because the invisible hitboxes are touching.

i dont know why we arent allowed to display champion hitboxes like in custom games. this would fix so many issues about how misleading they are.

i think the best way to explain it is to imagine league models like tabletop figurines. imagine theyre all standing on a circular platform, and that platform is the champions hitbox.

only due to the isometric view, the hitbox also appears mostly shifted behind the champion model.

Games with accurate hitboxes always feel so much better than crappily made ones.
Doubly so if it's a competitive game because then both the players can accurately predict where and when something is going to hit and that gives both the players more security in what they're doing.

I would like better hitboxes but i think that riot would need to change the engine or remake all the hitboxes fro scratch.
1) For what i understand all hitboxes are circular and champion hitboxes instead of begin unique are categorized in small, medium and large but champion don't fit exactly so already base champion hitboxes are misleading
2)Skillshot have a circular hitbox too and to hit a champion you only need that the 2 hitboxes touch, also the game have a 3D graphic but it works in 2D and most skill shot animation have height (lux is an example) while their hitbox is only 2d. 
3)For what i understand the game have a strange way to handle lag and connection problem, the server and the client are often desynchronized so the client think that champion x is in that position while the server think otherwise, champion y throw a spell to champion x and the server calculate if they champion has been hit based on his data then the information are send back to the client that show champion x begin hit even if for the client the wasn't.

I was recently up against a Jinx who used her W in my direction, not only did it clearly miss by about the length of two minions, but half a second after the ability disapeared, it seemingly came around and "hit" me anyways half a second later. It was pretty funny for me to get Zapped out of no where, half a second after the ability disapeared, but yeah hitboxes in the game are just a joke. 

It can be really funny when it happens, but there's nothing balanced about Nautilus being able to hook someone behind a wave or Thresh's hook to redirect itself like a homing missile.

One example is Diana's combo of Q >R, the animation is stupid fast, but my hitbox lags behind and I still get hit by things that should have missed. And also the damage is applied after the animation happens, its not instant enough during some duels cause I end up dying and the damage never applies, while I should have won the duel.

Agreed. I fell victim to A-Sol last night, his passive (visually) didn't even touch me, even when it was in W form, yet somehow, it would still "hit" me and do damage. Nothing is more frustrating than dodging a graphic just to be smashed by some invisible circle.

EDIT: I was playing as Annie, a champion with one of the smallest hit box circles, so the hit boxes on Sol's passive definitely extend way beyond the graphic.

EDIT 2: Riot will more than likely never change this aspect of the game. I get the impression they would respond, "Oh you know it's like that? Well just play around it." In higher ranked play most people realize these things and have the experience to know how far away they need to be to avoid the hitbox, not the graphic. Still, in the heat of the moment, all you think about is the visual sometimes.
